reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: F.a: Developing Wood and Forest Union in Myanmar

description.narrative: The project aims at developing a capable, independent and democratic trade union movement in Myanmar, which will ensure that TU rights, decent work and democratic TU culture will prevail.New government regime is trying to apply principles of democracy in M yanmar. At the same time the civil society and trade unionism is evolving. The new labour legislation of 2012 will ensure freedom of association and registration of a union. The project strengthens TUs operating conditions, promotes working opportunities a nd enhances the application of terms and conditions for decent work in the construction and forest sectors.At the outset the project will map forest industries in Myanmar, identifying target companies and forming a basis for effective organising strategy. Also a 3-year-training plan will be developed.In the beginning, the project will enhance and benefit FTUM union, specifically their organisers, trainers and leadership. The ultimate beneficiaries will include forest sector workers and their communities.The project is coordinated by Building and Wood Workers International (BWI), and implemented by their affiliates in Myanmar (FTUM), in conjunction with FTUM affiliates.
